relationships.description: Communicating about Acosta's representation at hearings

analysis.purpose: To forward information about who will represent Acosta at hearings and seek clarification on representation arrangements
analysis.significance: Shows Jeffrey Epstein's interest in and communication about legal representation for Alex Acosta, who was involved in Epstein's previous plea deal

notable_quotes: He will be by himself. Perhaps a trump administration aide to assist and accompany him.
Who will represent Acosta at hearings please note
red_flags: Interest in legal representation for government official involved in previous case

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this communication

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - this is a routine inquiry about legal representation arrangements

public_knowledge.context: Alex Acosta was the US Attorney who approved Jeffrey Epstein's controversial 2008 plea deal; this email shows Epstein's continued interest in Acosta's affairs during Trump administration

analysis.summary: Jeffrey Epstein forwards an email from Roy Black discussing who will represent Alex Acosta at hearings, noting he may be accompanied by a Trump administration aide, showing Epstein's ongoing interest in the legal affairs of the prosecutor who handled his previous case.
